content: Awesome

content: This is the most fun and relaxing game I have ever played! The only thing I wish for you to add is worms, dogs, and cats.
replyContent: Wow, thanks a lot for this nice review. I'm please to helps people to relax during those difficult time. Hum, for the worm, it will be difficult, because they are very small, and don't fit well in the current ecosystem. For the dogs and cats, I tried to mimic the forest ecosystem, but, it can be fun. I will add it to my wish list. thanks

content: Very nice relaxing game
replyContent: Thanks, this is exactly what I want it to be.

content: This game is very relaxing, but death needs to result in decay which generates soil. Mushrooms should speed decay, decay should feed plants, plants should feed animals, and repeat. The circle needs to close.
replyContent: Thanks for your good review. Animals and plants already generates dirt. Not only when they die, but even as they live. Yes, mushroom can speed the decomposition, this is a nice idea. I will take note.

content: Great game, nice and relaxing.
Amazing game, love the possibilities
replyContent: Thank a lot for the nice review. Have fun discovering the game.

content: I like this game... but my little sister scared To ghost! Can you remove ghosts
replyContent: You mean she is afraid of the forest spirit ? Ha, they are so cute... anyway. And yes, there is a way to avoid them. Send me an email I will be happy to help.

content: lovely game be helpful if placing in wrong spot a red X to help jellyfish need deep water but it takes way to long good they still have baby's a great reward if open daily be a plus for my gaming
replyContent: Thanks for the great review. There is no good or bad location, some animals prefer different things. And it is part of the game to discover it. Don't be afraid to do mistake, those aren't real animals anyway ;) .

content: waste of time.
replyContent: Time can't be wasted, or gained. Time just pass over our life...

content: Edit: inreplytothedeveloper: â€¢ yes, I mean that the current tools are too slow, move too little soil/water per activation of said tools, instead I would like to be able to affect a larger area per instance. â€¢ It's a..... I like the plant Kingdom aspect. I would appreciate some means to add and subtract elements i.e. soil, water "slowly over time" but in modest or extreme volumes. Perhaps by drawing shapes on screen.
replyContent: Thanks for the comment. There are tools to add or remove rock, soils and water. Otherwise, the soil slowly accumulate by itself over a long period of time (if there is life over it). I don't know if this what you mean.

content: Less micromanagement please. Dumb crabs leaving water and getting lost in the grass with no reason to, frogs hopping away from good environment. But what made me delete it was the time take takes to micromanage the water. Great game though! Love the graphics, and when you got an ecosystem right, it's very pleasant. Also, you have to micromanage predators, they can't seem to find equilibrium with their prey. EDIT: Thanks dev!
replyContent: Thanks for the nice review. I'm currently working on a new update to balance the predators. After that I will try to find a solution to those animals leaving their place. A animal should explore the world, otherwise only the same spot will be populated... There is a balance to have. This is complicated.

content: fun. needs a tutorial
replyContent: I have made a small web tutorial to help you start. : http://smalllivingworld.com/tutorial.html If you have any question, don't hesitate to send me an email. Yes, I answer to every email I receive. I'm that good !

content: Good foundation. Needs Google Play achievements.
replyContent: Thanks for the review. Yah, unfortunately, I didn't include Google Achievements. But, there are stand-alone achievements in the game.... maybe I can connect those to google play, it should not be that difficult no....

content: Nice
replyContent: Thanks a lot.

content: This game is great.

content: Cool game could be way better ðŸ˜Ž After downloading i played for a bit then haven't opened for months??? It was fun ? I haven't uninstalled yet? If that says something.
Good app
replyContent: Thank you for playing.

content: The concept is awesome. However, some values need tweaking. I enjoy watching my world grow. However, I find it almost impossible to stabilize ecosystems. It's almost like you always need to tend to your plants and animals. Frogs keep hopping away from their swamps when it's perfect, there's no natural water cycle that can fuel the ecosystem and water levels only deplete instead of recycling themselves. Instead, I'm constantly throwing animals back in their habitats and constantly pouring water.
It's sucks
Nice i enjoyed it for a couple of hours
App is nice but the graphics needed to be improved. Work more. I know you can do it
Very engaging and challenging in all the right ways! I played for 2 hours straight and can't stop thinking about how to optimize my world.

Chickens and fish tend get overpopulated really fast. The only thing stopping the fish from eating all the seaweed is to get a shark (which costs soooo kuch) and the chiken doesn't have a natural predator so I just result to killing them all. I do hope the chicken will get a predator in the next update. And also it's hard to build a swamp ecosystem. But nonetheless this is a good game to zone out to
Lag is inbearable, sorry :( game runs at what, 4-6 fps? With around 0.5sec delay on scroll and taps? On a snapdragon 835. Idea is awesome, but engine needs a rework, my dude.
Thank you for giving the game away.
This app is so boring
Moto G7 - installed. Need a microscope to read anything on screen - Cannot read any of the text, font far too small!
Very nice, relaxing ecosystem simulator. I just wish the buttons and menus would be a little bit optimized for my 5 inch display.
Maintain the game is pretty much hard. You need to keep growing things as they finish, it's pretty complex. But for 5 mb game is okay !!
Game is unplayable on mobile due to the tiny UI and unreadable text. Needs to be scaled up.

This game is actually fun. Challenges you to create a balanced ecosystem. Want to see this app develop. But the predators breed way too fast and eat way too soon. The animals AI need to be tuned. Like the crabs are in a perfect area they leave despite having plenty of food and committing suicide lol. Same goes for other animals, they can't seem complacent. Also it would be nice to have seasons, with water freezing, drought summers ect. But need smarter AI Please.
replyContent: Thanks for this fair review. I have to agree, some adjustment in the animal behavior is needed. The animals try to explore the area when everything is going well, but sometime this is not a good idea.If they all stay at the same place, they will eat all the food and die. If you have recommendation, send me an email.

content: Slow, relaxing, enjoyable.
replyContent: That is exactly the type of game I wanted to create. Thanks for your great review.

content: Fun
replyContent: thanks

content: Hey man, are you still working on this game? I love it so much that I wanted to try and make something similar, may I ask what game engine are you using to make it?
replyContent: Hi, you should contact me by email, reviews aren't the best place to discuss. For now the development is on hold, I'm taking a small break before figuring out what to do next. I would be happy to support your porject. Send me an email

content: A+++ amazing game, worth every miniscule minute you put into it. Engrossing, emotional, challenging. Hope to see more for this game from the developer, love it!
replyContent: Wow, thanks a lot.... I don't know if it deserve all of this, but thanks ;) . I'm happy that some people like it so much.

content: This game is very fun, peaceful to play. I wish there were options to slow down the time further so the forest didn't die so quickly once it's established and would love to have more long living trees
replyContent:
Thanks for your great review. 
Yes I know, sometime rain is rare. Bad thing happen from time to time. 
A fast-forward or a slow-down option are great idea... I will add those to my next project list.

content: fun, interesting game! runs great and is both simple and full of things to do! would love to see more from this game like more animals, bigger worlds, and maybe a button to clean up dead animals? anyway this game is well worth paying for the paid version if you like world creating sims where you can build a little eco system :) hope you all add even more to it some day!
replyContent: Wow, what a great review ;) I can't ask for more. I think this is a perfect summary. Nothing else to add. Yes, more stuff would be nice, indeed. But I should keep some idea for my next project ;)

content: I think it has potential, but waay too small looking and the zoom in ain't that great.
replyContent: Yes, sorry, the icon size is among the top problems. Unfortunatly it is a little too late to change the UI. You can try the zoom option in the setting page (the gear in the first menu). For some it helps.

content: Very rough and lackluster.
replyContent: Sorry. This is an indie project made by a solo developper. I can garanty that I put all my love into it ;) .

content: Really good relaxing God sim. Question dev? There is a huge ammount of potential here. Any future plans to make a larger game perhaps on Steam?
replyContent:
Hi, bonjour... Thanks for your nice review.
And, as for the question..... pfffff, I have some other projects in mind, but I haven't decided yet. A lot of people are requesting to have humans in the game, which can be very cool. And I may have another tinhg unrelated. But for now I'm taking a small break, I have put too much time in the project. Thk

content: Edit: thanks for the feedback; maybe implement a suspend mode where you can sort of freeze areas when they get to peak development? Ha if only life had that mode. Everything is growing/dying so quickly you can't leave it alone for a second. You'll get everything in one area balanced but meanwhile in other areas you have a forest of tree husks to clean and most of your animal species are extinct. It's hectic. Clearly lots of love went into this game but more frustrating than fun for me.
replyContent: Thanks for the review. Really, you find the game going to fast. I usually received the opposite feedback ;). But I can understand. But you know, you can see this as a "laissez-aller" exercise (let it go). Yes, for forest can be dying at the otherside of the map, but that's also ok ;). Just a idea like that. And Thanks for the good review.

content: This game refuses to download or give a refund. Reporting to Google Play.
replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenient. Do you mean downloading the game from the Google Play Store ?  Because the download part has nothing to do with the game itself, this may be a problem with Google or with your connection. The game downloads nothing after the initial install. Also, the the refund is all managed by Google, I have to do with this.

content: I think this game is a great simulation. Love the pixel graphics.

content: Solvit versionem ad me diligis! Et addictive sic simplex. It relaxat me

content: Having played the original (free) version pretty much from the first release, I eagerly anticipated the release of this FULL - PAID version and what updates that would bring.... I'm not going to lie, I was quite disappointed. Sandbox mode is pretty useless as it doesn't count achievements and cannot be "played" like the usual world's. Was expecting closer to MAP EDITOR that can be used to play (quick mode, where the world is already pretty favourable) or GOD mode to explore options etc. 4/5
replyContent: Thanks for your good review. And, I'm sorry that you didn't like the SandBox Mode. It is basicaly the same without any points or score restriction. I didn't know what else to do ? And for the achievements, I thought it will be a good idea to remove them, because it was unfair and way too easy to collect.

content: Feels like the successor to foxes and rabbits on the spectrum or Sheppard on the amiga. Love it!
replyContent: Thanks for the review. You are a real retro guy ;)  I touched an Amiga a couple of time, this was a very long time ago. Thanks for the venerable comparison.

content: This game makes no sense you plant your plants and there dead in 2 second
replyContent:
You need to have the proper terrain for the type of plant you want to seed. If you start slowly and observe the plants status, it should be easy. For example, don't try to seed flower under water, they will die instantly. 
Send me an email directly, I will try to help.

content: This is my favorite game!! It has so many endless possibilities.. I wish only for a creative mode eventually, maybe only available in this paid version
replyContent: Favorite game? Really ? You are very kind, thanks. Yes, there is a Sand-Box mode, and it is available in the UNLOCK (paid) version (which is the App you are currently reviewing). Try the Game Icons on the right, you will have everything unlocked and unlimited points. Thanks.

content: Great game I love it I am so happy I got the full version it's really nice and calming, you really get lost in the development of the different ecosystems you can make, it was so worth it I love it. content: I love the game and do not regret buying it. Btw for the animal encyclopedia the troll part should say "...Everything he can find" Instead of "Everthing he can founds" Anyway really fun game keep up the good work. :)
replyContent: I'm glad you like it. Thanks for the review. Sorry for the spelling error. English is my secondary language. I will do the correction right away. Have fun.

content: Love the game and would love to see more updates however I'm not sure what the difference between the base game and this unlocked version?
replyContent: Thank for the super review. For the last 6 months, I was doing 1 or 2 release per month. That's a lot I think ;). I may slow down next year. The UNLOCKED version include a Sandbox mode (right game icons), and have all the content already unlocked.

content: I love the game. And Its worth it to purchase the Game. Keep it Up! ^_^

content: A calm and inviting stroll threw a magical new world... first game I give all 5 stars for all aspects look forward to more and will gladly support expansion... People that build there own little village and live off the land would be nifty

content: Favorite game on the app store, especially good on a bad day. Super cute pixel graphics and a ton of little critters to play with. Cant wait to try sandbox mode!

content: Really good game simple but addictive, would give 5star only the issue I find is the lack of extra things to do once you've clocked up enough points to buy everything, need more items and objects and more animals trees and everything else, I want more more more! So dear creator of the app please add more things to do and put into the game, earn your 5*!
replyContent: Thanks for the good review. I think that wanting more stuff is a good sign. And yes, I'm working to add more stuff. First, I have a total of 20 objects on the board. They should come in the next month, or so. After that, I have 2 to 3 new animals and some plants (mostly water related).  So, will I get my 5 stars with that ??? ;)
